description: Dive into "Shinjuku's Hidden Gems: Explore for Free" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Shinjuku's Hidden Gems: Explore for Free

places.generalDescription: Toyama Park, located in the Okubo area, is a sprawling public park known for its hilly and verdant landscape. It is home to Hakone Yama, the highest summit within the Yamanote Line circle, offering panoramic views of the Shinjuku skyline. The park features a splash pond, sports complex, and a dog-friendly environment with a marked walking/jogging circuit. Families can enjoy various play areas for kids and ample shade from numerous trees.

sources.snippet: Toyama park is home to Hakone Yama, an elevated mound known as the highest summit inside the Yamanote Line circle, and the two surrounding areas split by Meiji Dori into the Hakoneyama and Okubo grounds. While the summit at Hakoneyama stands at a mere 44.6 meters tall, it is still the tallest elevation within the Yamanote Line circle, offering a wide view of the Shinjuku skyline.
sources.shortName: 41 Things to Do in Shinjuku, Tokyo | GOOD LUCK TRIP

places.name: Toyama Park (Okubo Area)

reviews.text: Beautiful park for locals and those going to the rec center. I was looking for a pull up bar to do calisthenics while in Tokyo, almost gave up my search before stumbling upon this (slightly northwest of rec center)

Great community park. There are many sports activities going on for families. There's a trail designed for joggers in the back.

There are many people sitting on the bench reading or just talking with friends. There is one huge Sakura tree in the center where groups of people gathering around it celebrating spring season.

A huge restroom at the entrance. A huge sports building on the right corner.
This park is beautiful. It's a wonderful, peaceful place. There are lots of trees, play areas, and lots of places to sit and relax. It's a nice place to spend some quiet time.

places.address: 3 Chome Okubo, Shinjuku City, Tokyo 169-0072, Japan

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Tokyo, Yoyogi Park is a sprawling urban oasis that spans an impressive 134 acres. This vibrant park features serene lakes, charming fountains, and lush forested areas adorned with mature trees, making it a perfect escape from the city's hustle and bustle. Located just south of Shinjuku and near the iconic Yoyogi National Gymnasium, it's easily accessible for both locals and tourists alike.

sources.snippet: Yoyogi Park is somewhere in between Shibuya and Shinjuku, across the street of Harujuku. It’s a serene and calm park, that is quite huge, and within there is a beautiful temple called Meiji Jingu that you can check out for free.
sources.siteName: Offbeat Escapades | Offbeat Travels & Van Life Blog
sources.shortName: 20 Best Things to Do in Tokyo Japan for Free - Offbeat Escapades

places.name: Yoyogi Park

reviews.text: A nice park to relax in or go for a jog.  Most of the park is tree lined paths and bench areas though it has a few extra sections.  There is a beautiful butterfly garden on the south side that I'd recommend.  A herb / rose garden.  A dog park.  And a lake for viewing birds... Though they were hiding during our visit.

Green, expansive, gorgeous. There are so many words that could describe Yoyogi Park but those are my top three. I loved the greenery, art, wildlife, and the First Flight Monument. Easy to get to, easy to navigate. Even though we walked around for a few hours, there was still more to see. Don't miss it!

Photography by Jason Taylor (Except for the pictures I took)

This park does not have a lot to offer but this is one good place to spend some time off, peaceful "me time" and have picnics with your loved ones. This is just a 5 minute walk from the Meiji Shrine. By the time I visited, Roses are in bloom making the park more interesting to visit.
